div.p: To start with it was fine, there again as the pressures and stress grew up in the business and in the family life as well I unfortunately
got into alcoholism and had a nervous breakdown. When first training and learning it was a comfortable work-life balance,
I think as it grew and it became a family business it all became like a monster we’d created so the work ethic or the work balance
was 80% work, 20% family so it impacted on my life greatly and probably a factor that I didn’t take into control early enough.
